usbsimulator.protocol.usb_request module

class usbsimulator.protocol.usb_request.DeviceRequest(bmRequestType: bytes = b'\x00', bRequest: bytes = b'\x00', wValue: bytes = b'\x00', wIndex: bytes = b'\x00', wLength: bytes = b'\x00', data: bytes = None)[source]

Bases: object

Abstract class representing a Device Request as defined in USB1.1 spec. Please consider reading 9.3 from USB1.1 specification.

Parameters:

  • bmRequestType (bytes) – the code of the bmRequestType

  • bRequest (bytes) – the code of the bRquest

  • wValue (bytes) – the code of the wValue

  • wIndex (bytes) – the value of the wIndex

  • wLength (bytes) – the value of wLength

get_bytes()[source]

Get the DataField object using the fields of this object.

Returns:

the DataField object from the DeviceRequests

Return type:

DataField

class usbsimulator.protocol.usb_request.SET_ADDRESS(device_address: int)[source]

Bases: DeviceRequest

SET_ADDRESS device request. Please consider reading 9.4.6 from USB1.1 specification.

Parameters:

device_address – the device address

Example (create a SET_ADDRESS device request):

 1from usbsimulator.protocol.packet import DataPacket
 2from usbsimulator.protocol.field import Pid, PidField
 3from usbsimulator.protocol.device_request import SET_ADDRESS
 4
 5device_address = 31
 6
 7pid = PidField(Pid.DATA_DATA0)
 8device_request = SET_ADDRESS(device_address)
 9
10set_add_device_rq = DataPacket(
11    pid=pid
12    data=device_request.get_bytes()
13)
class usbsimulator.protocol.usb_request.SET_DESCRIPTOR(descriptor_type: bytes, language_id: bytes, descriptor_length: bytes, descriptor: bytes)[source]

Bases: DeviceRequest

SET_DESCRIPTOR request

Please consider reading 9.4.8 from USB1.1 specification.

class usbsimulator.protocol.usb_request.GET_DESCRIPTOR(descriptor_type: bytes, language_id: bytes, descriptor_length: bytes, descriptor: bytes = b'')[source]

Bases: DeviceRequest

GET_DESCRIPTOR request

Please consider reading 9.4.3 from USB1.1 specification.

Parameters:

  • descriptor_type – the type of the descriptor (p.e DEVICE descriptor)

  • language_id (bytes) – the language ID for the descriptor (usefull for string descriptors only)

  • descriptor_length (bytes) – the length of the descriptor

Example (create a GET_DESCRIPTOR device request for device descriptor):

 1from usbsimulator.protocol.packet import DataPacket
 2from usbsimulator.protocol.field import Pid, PidField
 3from usbsimulator.protocol.device_request import GET_DESCRIPTOR
 4
 5device_address = 31
 6
 7pid = PidField(Pid.DATA_DATA0)
 8# GET_DESCRIPTOR for device descriptor 
 9device_request = GET_DESCRIPTOR(
10    descriptor_type=b'\x01',
11    language_id=b'\x00\x00',
12    descriptor_length=b'\x12\x00',
13    descriptor=b''
14)
15
16get_desc_device_rq = DataPacket(
17    pid=pid
18    data=device_request.get_bytes()
19)
class usbsimulator.protocol.usb_request.GET_DESCRIPTOR_RESPONSE(descriptor_type: bytes, language_id: bytes, descriptor_length: bytes, descriptor: bytes)[source]

Bases: DeviceRequest

GET_DESCRIPTOR response

Please consider reading 9.6 from USB1.1 specification.

Parameters:

  • descriptor_type (bytes) – the type of the descriptor

  • language_id (bytes) – the ID of the language

  • descriptor – bytes

Descript_length:

the length of the descriptor
